text: James Edward Rothman (born November 3, 1950) is an American biochemist. He is the Fergus F. Wallace Professor of Biomedical Sciences at Yale University, the Chairman of the Department of Cell Biology at Yale School of Medicine, and the Director of the Nanobiology Institute at the Yale West Campus. Rothman worked at Columbia University and a research professor at the UCL Queen Square Institute of Neurology, University College London. Rothman was awarded the 2013 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his work on vesicle trafficking (shared with Randy Schekman and Thomas C. SÃ¼dhof). He was elected a foreign member of the Academia Europaea in 2015. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:American biologists Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from Massachusetts Category:People from Haverhill, Massachusetts Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: James Rothman
